item.title: Tissue Culture Plant Specialist – Category I
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The Global Objective of this mission is to enhance the capacity of the UB Micro-propagation facility to support the Agricultural Industry in Belize.
The specific objective of this mission is to assess the commercial and technical feasibility of the UB micro-propagation facility in Belize.

Tissue Culture Plant Specialist – Category I

Education

  • Master’s Degree in Agriculture Science with specific experience in plant micro-propagation or other relevant related discipline, or the equivalent of 12 years’ professional experience as a professional in commercial plants micro-propagation.

Specific Experience:

  • Tissue culture plant specialist with ten years’ experience in commercial plant micro-propagation, including bananas for the EU market.
  • Strong background in business administration and commercial management of tissue culture plants.
  • Experience in managing a commercial laboratory would be a strong asset.
  • Specific work related expertise in strategic planning, work-plan development and implementation, laboratory certification and business plan development.
  • Demonstrated substantial professional track record in the technical, managerial and financial aspects of commercial-scale plant micro-propagation of bananas and (if possible) other crops mentioned.

Language skills:

  • English, with the ability to communicate in Spanish.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Agriculture and/or Rural Development Expert – Category II
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The overall objective of the project of which this contract will be a part is as follows:

  • To support the diversification process following liberalisation of the European market for bananas in the framework of the WTO; and
  • Achieve a sustained growth in production and exports of the agricultural sector, thus providing increased income for producers and exporters and contributing to employment, poverty reduction, rural development and social environmental and economic stability.

Key Expert 2: Agriculture and/or Rural Development Expert – Category II

Qualifications and skills:

  • University degree in Degree in Agronomy, Rural Development, Agri-economy or related fields.

General professional experience:

  • Minimum of 10 years of professional experience in development programmes, with minimum 5 years in ACP countries;
  • Minimum of 5 years of professional experience with agricultural organisations, agricultural sector institutions, agricultural strategy development, capacity building and support to farmer groups.

Specific professional experience:

  • Experience in the evaluation of EU funded programmes and projects;
  • Experience working with Caribbean Islands' countries will be considered as an asset ;
  • Fluent in spoken and written English.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

  • To support the diversification process following liberalisation of the European market for bananas in the framework of the WTO; and
  • Achieve a sustained growth in production and exports of the agricultural sector, thus providing increased income for producers and exporters and contributing to employment, poverty reduction, rural development and social environmental and economic stability.

Key Expert 1: Development Economist/ Institutional Expert (TL) – Category I

Qualifications and skills:

  • University degree in agricultural-economics, rural development studies, business administration or other relevant disciplines.

General professional experience:

  • Minimum of 15 years of professional experience in rural development programmes, with minimum 10 years in ACP countries. Specific professional experience:
  • Minimum of 7 years of professional experience with institutional development And/or Agricultural policies and /or Agricultural Economics. Specific professional experience
  • Experience in the evaluation of EU funded Development programmes and project;
  • Good knowledge of international and regional development issues;
  • Experience working with Caribbean Islands' countries will be considered as an asset as well as previous assignments as a team leader, and;
  • Fluent in spoken and written English, with excellent report writing skills.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com

item.title: Expert with Climate Change Experience in Tanzania
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The assignment is an ex-post evaluation aiming at:

  • detecting the real changes in the field and analyse the changes attributable to the interventions;
  • check and explains achieved results and in particular their impact on the eco-villages' communities;
  • identify and judge unexpected results or unachieved results;
  • assess the sustainability of the interventions' benefits;
  • for those projects who are implementing a second GCCA project, identify how lessons learnt from the first phase can be constructively used in the second phase and previous shortcomings, if any, be avoided.

Expert with Climate Change Experience in Tanzania

  • A solid and diversified experience in the specific fields of expertise needed (natural resources, environment, climate change), including experience in evaluation of projects;
  • Experience in the region;
  • Full working knowledge of English, and excellent report writing skills
  • Fully conversant with the principles and working methods of project cycle management and EC aid delivery methods.
  • Master degree in Environmental Science, Rural Development, Agriculture, Water Engineering or equivalent
  • Familiar with project evaluations; experience with EU procedures is an asset
  • At least 6 years' experience in the above mentioned fields
  • Experience in climate change adaptation activities in Tanzania
  • Language: English and Swahili

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to chloe_messenger@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Expert 2 and Expert 3: Civil Society Thematic Specialists (Category I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
To assist the National Authorising Officer/EU Delegation in the identification of a civil society support programme, by defining an appropriate basis for the formulation/design of the programme, in accordance with the 11th EDF National Indicative Programme for Nigeria 2014-2020, and relevant EU templates and guidelines.

Focal Sectors:

  • Civil society and 11th EDF NIP focal sector 1 - health/ nutrition/ resilience
  • Civil society and 11th EDF NIP focal sector 2 - sustainable energy and access to electricity
  • Civil society and 11th EDF NIP focal sector 3 rule of law/governance/and democracy

Expert 2 and Expert 3: Civil Society Thematic Specialists (Category I)

  • At least a University Degree in Political Science, Law, Sociology, Anthropology, Development Studies, International Relations, Public Administration, Medicine, Public Health, Economics, Business, Engineering or directly related discipline, or equivalent.
  • Experience in management of projects relating to civil society, democratic governance, and/or related areas.
  • Experience in project design and development of logical framework.
  • Specific expertise in civil society AND areas directly relating to focal sector 1, 2 or 3 of the 11th EDF NIP, in Sub-Saharan Africa.
  • Full working knowledge of English, as well as excellent report writing and communication skills
  • Minimum 12 years of professional experience on project management/ design/ implementation of civil society, governance, democracy, and/or related, programmes in a developing country context.
  • Minimum 3 years of recent and continuous professional experience in civil society AND areas directly relating to focal sector 1, 2 or 3 of the 11th EDF NIP gained in-country, in Sub-Saharan Africa.
  • Minimum 5 years recent and continuous in-country professional experience on civil society in Sub-Saharan Africa, with preference in Nigeria, gained through direct work experience or/and advisory functions.
  • Experience with capacity development projects as per guidance provided by the “EU backbone strategy” (http://ec.europa.eu/development/icenter/repository/backbone_strategy_technical_cooperation_en.pdf) and the “Guidelines on "Making technical cooperation more effective”“ (http://ec.europa.eu/europeaid/how/ensure-aideffectiveness/ documents/guidelinesontcfinaleen.pdf).
  • Familiarity with international frameworks and standards for civil society effectiveness.
  • Experience in human rights based approach to development programming.
  • Proven field research and report writing skills;
  • Proven ability to promote innovative approaches and to identify practical solutions to overcome challenges to time-critical projects;
  • Excellent interpersonal skills to relate to counterparts on all levels of hierarchy;
  • IT literate, very good knowledge of data-processing and office automation software.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to chloe_messenger@dai.com

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Team Leader, Senior Civil Society Expert with EDF Experience
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
To assist the National Authorising Officer/EU Delegation in the identification of a civil society support programme, by defining an appropriate basis for the formulation/design of the programme, in accordance with the 11th EDF National Indicative Programme for Nigeria 2014-2020, and relevant EU templates and guidelines.

Focal Sectors:

  • Civil society and 11th EDF NIP focal sector 1 - health/ nutrition/ resilience
  • Civil society and 11th EDF NIP focal sector 2 - sustainable energy and access to electricity
  • Civil society and 11th EDF NIP focal sector 3 rule of law/governance/and democracy

Team Leader, Senior Civil Society Expert with EDF Experience

  • At least a Master Degree in Political Science, Law, Sociology, Anthropology, Development Studies, International Relations, Public Administration, Medicine, Public Health, Economics, Business, Engineering, or directly related discipline, or equivalent.
  • Experience in leading missions for project identification and formulation in civil society ,democratic governance, and/or related areas.
  • Knowledge of EDF procedures.
  • Experience in political economy/drivers of change type of assessment, or similar, and theory of change.
  • Experience in needs/risk/stakeholders' analysis.
  • Experience in project design and development of logical frameworks.
  • Experience in civil society AND areas directly related to any of the focal sectors 1, 2 or 3 of the 11th EDF NIP, in Sub-Saharan Africa.
  • Full working knowledge of English, as well as excellent report writing and communication skills
  • Minimum 12 years of professional experience on project management/design/implementation of civil society programmes in a developing country context.
  • Minimum 5 years of professional experience in civil society AND areas directly related to any of the focal sectors 1, 2 or 3 of the 11th EDF NIP, gained in a county in Sub-Saharan Africa.
  • Specific expertise on civil society in developing country context, including on methodologies and support modalities.
  • Minimum 3 years of experience with EDF procedures.
  • At least 2 missions leading project identification and formulation of EDF programmes on civil society, democratic governance, and/or related areas.
  • Experience in development cooperation in Sub-Saharan Africa.
  • Experience with capacity development projects as per guidance provided by the “EU backbone strategy” (http://ec.europa.eu/development/icenter/repository/backbone_strategy_technical_cooperation_en.pdf) and the “Guidelines on "Making technical cooperation more effective” (http://ec.europa.eu/europeaid/how/ensure-aideffectiveness/ documents/guidelinesontcfinaleen.pdf).
  • Familiarity with international frameworks and standards for civil society effectiveness.
  • Experience in human rights based approach to development programming.
  • Proven field research and report writing skills;
  • Proven ability to promote innovative approaches and to identify practical solutions to overcome challenges to time-critical projects;
  • Excellent interpersonal skills to relate to counterparts on all levels of hierarchy;
  • IT literate, very good knowledge of data-processing and office automation software.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to chloe_messenger@dai.com

item.title: Experto en Cohesión Económica y Social, Participación Ciudadana, Desarrollo Rural y/o Desarrollo Fronterizo (Cat.II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
El objetivo principal del proyecto es contribuir al proceso de integración regional andino consolidando condiciones para un desarrollo sostenible con la participación organizada de la Sociedad Civil. Más concretamente, el proyecto pretende profundizar condiciones de buena gobernanza en el Sistema Andino de Integración (SAI), a partir del fortalecimiento y la participación activa de redes regionales de la Sociedad Civil y administraciones locales en iniciativas de desarrollo socio-económico en Zonas de Integración Fronteriza (ZIF).

Experto en Cohesión Económica y Social, Participación Ciudadana, Desarrollo Rural y/o Desarrollo Fronterizo (Cat.II)

Preparación y cualificaciones:

  • Postgrado universitario con titulación adecuada a la ATI / Lote 1: Economía, ciencias sociales y/o económicas o carreras afines;
  • Es imprescindible el dominio del idioma español, lengua de trabajo durante la ATI; deseable buen conocimiento del inglés y/o francés;
  • Buena capacidad de redacción de informes en español, comunicación, trabajo en equipo y negociación;
  • Disponibilidad en las fechas requeridas y estar físicamente apto para desplazamientos a los países de la región andina (Bolivia, Colombia y Ecuador).

Experiencia profesional:

  • Experiencia profesional demostrada de al menos 6 años en aspectos y programas de cohesión económica y social, participación ciudadana, desarrollo rural y/o desarrollo fronterizo;
  • Conocimiento de los métodos de trabajo de la Gestión del Ciclo de Proyecto (PCM) y el Marco Lógico, así como en procedimientos de la Comisión Europea (nuevas reglas desde 2007);
  • Conocimiento y experiencia comprobada de procedimientos de la Comisión Europea (Guía Práctica de Procedimientos Contractuales para las acciones exteriores de la Unión Europea y Guía Práctica de Presupuestos – Programa);
  • Haber participado en por lo menos 3 procedimientos de licitación de proyectos de cooperación realizados por la Comisión Europea;
  • Al menos 3 años de experiencia en países de América Latina, de preferencia en la región andina.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com

*WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS *

item.title: Expert 3 – Civic Education and Civil Society/Non-State Actors (Category II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The global objective is to assist the Government of Malawi and the EC in the formulation of a programme in support of access to justice and democratic accountability under the 11th EDF.

Project location: Lilongwe, Blantyre, Zomba and Mzuzu

Expert 3 – Civic Education and Civil Society/Non-State Actors (Category II):

  • Master’s degree in Law or a similarly relevant field.
  • At least 6 years of solid experience and expertise in development programmes in the field of programme or project management on civic education and civil society/non-state actors;
  • Specific knowledge of EC project formulation procedures and solid overall experience with EDF procedures, guidelines, EC templates is essential
  • Experience of designing and implementing interventions using different aid modalities is essential;
  • Knowledge of related GoM polices and understanding of Governance in Malawi is essential;
  • Experience in successfully mainstreaming crosscutting issues as environment, climate change, gender and HIV/AIDS;
  • Excellent written and spoken English.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to veronica_hernandez-castilla@dai.com

item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Description of the project: The global objective of the assignment is to provide the Government of the Republic of Timor-Leste and the EC with sufficient information to make an informed judgement about the performance and impact of the 10th EDF ICBP II (Institutional Capacity Building Programme) and TCF II (Technical Cooperation facility).

Experience and Qualifications required

  • At least 6 years of professional experience in development cooperation
  • Master’s degree in Economics, Development studies, Public Administration project management or any other social science related to the assignment
  • Demonstrated 6 years work in formulation, management and evaluation of development cooperation programmes in developing countries
  • At least 3 evaluations of European Commission projects using the EC methodological approach
  • Excellent knowledge of the role of the NAO in EDF funds management (experience working closely with, or within, an NAO office or support unit would be a very good asset).
  • Experience in capacity building projects of government/project management structure
  • Excellent analytical and reporting skills
  • Fluent in English spoken and written

item.title: Expert 4 (Catégories I) – Spécialiste en irrigation et drainage
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Le projet a deux objectifs principaux:

  • Evaluation du PACOMP-ON : D’apprécier dans quelle mesure les appuis fournis dans le cadre du PAMOCP-ON ont permis d’atteindre les résultats fixes dans la Convention de financement et de porter un jugement sur leurs contributions a la réalisation des objectifs de développement sectoriel en particulier.
  • Identification et formulation d’un programme d’appui à la filière riz et à l’Office du Niger

Qualification et compétences :

  • BAC+5 dans le secteur concerne

Expérience professionnelle générale :

  • 12 ans d’expérience générale dans le secteur
  • Disposer des compétences spécifiques en Génie rural ou en Génie civil
  • Expérience professionnelle des systèmes d’irrigation gravitaire et des questions foncières.
  • Bonne connaissance des pays de la sous-région
  • Une expérience professionnelle avec les institutions maliennes sera un atout
  • Maitrise de la langue française.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to veronica_hernandez-castilla@dai.com

item.title: AWP 2 Projects Review
item.author: Bryan Schuetz
item.description:
The Beyond WTO Program (B-WTO) was developed in response to a request from the Government of Vietnam (GoV) for donor support to help with managing economic integration and the transition to a market economy following WTO accession. The B-WTO goal is “to strengthen government’s capacity to manage the integration of Vietnam into the global economy and the transition of Vietnam to a socialist market economy”. The immediate objective is “implementation of priority policy actions from the GoV’s Action Plan to enhance Vietnam’s capacity to sustain pro-poor growth (GAP)”.

The remit of this project was a review of the 2nd annual work plan’s implementation (AWP2) of Phase 2 of the B-WTO in May 2013. The objectives of the review were to:

  • Evaluate the project implementation performance and project results relative to the logical framework targets and evaluation criteria.
  • Evaluate the results achieved at the Component and Program’s level according to the Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) framework of the Program.
  • Identify lessons learned from implementation, make recommendations for the remaining duration of the program and the Independent Completion Report process.

item.title: Health Program M&E
item.author: Bryan Schuetz
item.description:
In partnership with the Ministry of Health (MoH), the Australian Government is scoping and piloting a new approach to engagement in the health sector in Timor-Leste. The program approach is innovative in several respects. Key program features are: a systems perspective; joint program oversight by MoH and Australian Government; an emphasis on capacity facilitation through coaching rather than an over-reliance on more traditional technical assistance approaches; ongoing processes of joint intervention design throughout implementation; and rapid cycles of evidence-informed adaptation. These will require significant investments in interactive, exploratory, and rigorous monitoring and evaluation, requiring support from an M&E Specialist that is comfortable with non-traditional M&E approaches.

The Health Program M&E Specialist worked with the Australian Government Timor-Leste Health Team to design an M&E system for Australia’s support to the health sector, that is aligned with the Ministry of Health’s draft Sector M&E Framework and consistent with Australian Aid Program M&E Standards. The primary purpose of the M&E System will be to support strategic management and ongoing improvement of the Australian Government - MoH partnership in the health sector.

item.title: Program 2013 Performance and Quality Mapping Exercise
item.author: Bryan Schuetz
item.description: AusAID’s PNG Program is looking to improve its performance and quality (P&Q) standards and systems. The purpose of this project was to map the PNG Program’s current P&Q capacity and systems, to address the risk of AusAID being unable to demonstrate results for its increased investments in PNG over the next four years. Over the last several years, the PNG Program has undertaken a number of M&E assessments and reviews which have identified key strengths and challenges within the program. This project was intended to pick up where these assessments left off. Through a desk review and consultations with sector teams, the Review Team were to distil key P&Q risks and issues for the PNG Program. The Review Team’s brief included the provision of recommendations on priority activities to support sector approaches to M&E, strengthen the Program’s ability to collect evidence, provide critical analysis and report on results.
